intro: Spermacoce leucadea, commonly known as white rattle, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. The plant produces small, white, clustered flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Spermacoce leucadea is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
